io.branch.referral

Class PrefHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.branch.referral.PrefHelper

  • public class PrefHelper
extends java.lang.Object

    A class that uses the helper pattern to provide regularly referenced static values and logging capabilities used in various other parts of the SDK, and that are related to globally set preference values.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PrefHelper.DebugNetworkCallback
      Debug connection callback that implements NetworkCallback to react to server calls to debug API end-points.

      • DEBUG_TRIGGER_NUM_FINGERS

        public static final int DEBUG_TRIGGER_NUM_FINGERS
        The debug action is triggered by holding a multi-touch gesture. This Integer value defines how many multi-touch points need to be held on the screen in order for the debug action to be triggered.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEBUG_TRIGGER_PRESS_TIME

        public static final int DEBUG_TRIGGER_PRESS_TIME
        The debug action is triggered by holding a multi-touch gesture. This Integer value defines how many milliseconds the gesture must be held in order for the debug action to be triggered.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static PrefHelper getInstance(Context context)

        Singleton method to return the pre-initialised, or newly initialise and return, a singleton object of the type PrefHelper.

        Parameters:
        context - The Context within which the object should be instantiated; this parameter is passed to the private PrefHelper(Context) constructor method.
        Returns:
        A PrefHelper object instance.

        Parameters:

        See Also:
        Branch}

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()

        Returns the currently set timeout value for calls to the Branch API. This will be the default SDK setting unless it has been overridden manually between Branch object instantiation and this call.

        Returns:
        An Integer value containing the currently set timeout value in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        Branch}

      • setRetryCount

        public void setRetryCount(int retry)

        Sets the value specifying the number of times that a Branch API call has been re-attempted.

        This overrides the default retry value.

        Parameters:
        retry - An Integer value specifying the value to be specified in preferences that determines the number of times that a Branch API call has been re- attempted.
        See Also:
        Branch}

      • setIdentityID

        public void setIdentityID(java.lang.String identity_id)

        Sets the KEY_IDENTITY_ID String value that has been set via the Branch API.

        This is used to identify a specific user ID and link that to a current session. Useful both for analytics and debugging purposes.

        Note: Not to be confused with setIdentity(String) - the name of the user

        Parameters:
        identity_id - A String value containing the currently configured identity within preferences.
        See Also:
        Branch}

      • getIdentityID

        public java.lang.String getIdentityID()

        Gets the KEY_IDENTITY_ID String value that has been set via the Branch API.

        Returns:
        A String value containing the currently configured user id within preferences.
        See Also:
        Branch}

      • setIdentity

        public void setIdentity(java.lang.String identity)

        Sets the KEY_IDENTITY String value that has been set via the Branch API.

        This is used to identify a specific user identity and link that to a current session. Useful both for analytics and debugging purposes.

        Note: Not to be confused with setIdentityID(String) - the UID reference of the user

        Parameters:
        identity - A String value containing the currently configured identity within preferences.
        See Also:
        Branch}

        public java.lang.String getIdentity()

        This is used to identify a specific user identity and link that to a current session. Useful both for analytics and debugging purposes.

        Note: Not to be confused with #getIdentityID(String) - the UID reference of the user

        Returns:
        A String value containing the username assigned to the currentuser ID.

      • getIsReferrable

        public int getIsReferrable()

        Gets the Integer value of the preference setting KEY_IS_REFERRABLE, which indicates whether or not the current session should be considered referrable.

        Returns:
        A Integer value indicating whether or not the session should be considered referrable.
        See Also:
        Branch}

      • setIsReferrable

        public void setIsReferrable()

        Sets the KEY_IS_REFERRABLE value in preferences to 1, or true if parsed as a Boolean. This value is used by the Branch object.

        • Sets KEY_IS_REFERRABLE to 1 - true - This session is referrable.

      • clearIsReferrable

        public void clearIsReferrable()

        Sets the KEY_IS_REFERRABLE value in preferences to 0, or false if parsed as a Boolean. This value is used by the Branch object.

        • Sets KEY_IS_REFERRABLE to 0 - false - This session is not referrable.

      • clearSystemReadStatus

        public void clearSystemReadStatus()

        Resets the time that the system was last read. This is used to calculate how "stale" the values are that are in use in preferences.

      • clearUserValues

        public void clearUserValues()

        Resets the user-related values that have been stored in preferences. This will cause a sync to occur whenever a method reads any of the values and finds the value to be 0 or unset.

      • setCreditCount

        public void setCreditCount(int count)

        Sets the credit count for the default bucket to the specified Integer, in preferences.

        Note: This does not set the actual value of the bucket itself on the Branch server, but only the cached value as stored in preferences for the current app. The age of that value should be checked before being considered accurate; read KEY_LAST_READ_SYSTEM to see when the last system sync occurred.

        Parameters:
        count - A Integer value that the default bucket credit count will be set to.

      • setCreditCount

        public void setCreditCount(java.lang.String bucket,
                           int count)

        Sets the credit count for the default bucket to the specified Integer, in preferences.

        Note: This does not set the actual value of the bucket itself on the Branch server, but only the cached value as stored in preferences for the current app. The age of that value should be checked before being considered accurate; read KEY_LAST_READ_SYSTEM to see when the last system sync occurred.

        Parameters:
        bucket - A String value containing the value of the bucket being referenced.
        count - A Integer value that the default bucket credit count will be set to.

      • getCreditCount

        public int getCreditCount()

        Get the current cached credit count for the default bucket, as currently stored in preferences for the current app.

        Returns:
        A Integer value specifying the current number of credits in the bucket, as currently stored in preferences.

      • getCreditCount

        public int getCreditCount(java.lang.String bucket)

        Get the current cached credit count for the default bucket, as currently stored in preferences for the current app.

        Parameters:
        bucket - - A String value containing the value of the bucket being referenced.
        Returns:
        A Integer value specifying the current number of credits in the bucket, as currently stored in preferences.

      • setActionTotalCount

        public void setActionTotalCount(java.lang.String action,
                                int count)

        Sets the count of total number of times that the specified action has been carried out during the current session, as defined in preferences.

        Parameters:
        action - - A String value containing the name of the action to return the count for.
        count - - An Integer value containing the total number of times that the specified action has been carried out during the current session.

      • setActionUniqueCount

                                 int count)

        Sets the count of the unique number of times that the specified action has been carried out during the current session, as defined in preferences.

        Parameters:
        action - - A String value containing the name of the action to return the count for.
        count - - An Integer value containing the total number of times that the specified action has been carried out during the current session.

      • getInteger

        public int getInteger(java.lang.String key)

        A basic method that returns an integer value from a specified preferences Key.

        Parameters:
        key - - A String value containing the key to reference.
        Returns:
        An Integer value of the specified key as stored in preferences.

      • getInteger

        public int getInteger(java.lang.String key,
                      int defaultValue)

        A basic method that returns an Integer value from a specified preferences Key, with a default value supplied in case the value is null.

        Parameters:
        key - - A String value containing the key to reference.
        defaultValue - - An Integer specifying the value to use if the preferences value is null.
        Returns:
        An Integer value containing the value of the specified key, or the supplied default value if null.

        Sets the value of the String key value supplied in preferences.

        Parameters:
        key - - A String value containing the key to reference.
        value - - A Float value to set the preference record to.

      • setString

        public void setString(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.String value)

        Sets the value of the String key value supplied in preferences.

        Parameters:
        key - - A String value containing the key to reference.
        value - - A String value to set the preference record to.

        public void setBool(java.lang.String key,
                    java.lang.Boolean value)

        Sets the value of the String key value supplied in preferences.

        Parameters:
        key - - A String value containing the key to reference.
        value - - A Boolean value to set the preference record to.

      • setExternDebug

        public void setExternDebug()

        Switches external debugging on.

      • getExternDebug

        public boolean getExternDebug()

        Gets the value of the debug status Boolean value.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value indicating the current state of external debugging.

      • disableExternAppListing

        public void disableExternAppListing()

        Sets the Boolean value that is checked prior to the listing of external apps to false.

      • getExternAppListing

        public boolean getExternAppListing()

        Sets the Boolean value that is checked prior to the listing of external apps.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value containing the current value of the BNC_App_Listing boolean.

      • disableSmartSession

        public void disableSmartSession()
        See Also:
        Branch#disableSmartSession()}

      • getSmartSession

        public boolean getSmartSession()

        Gets the state of the Boolean value indicating whether or not the Smart Session feature is enabled or not.

      • setDebug

        public void setDebug()

        Enable debugging, by setting the Boolean debug flags BNC_Debug and BNC_Debug_Connecting to true.

      • clearDebug

        public void clearDebug()

        Disable debugging, by setting the Boolean debug flags BNC_Debug and BNC_Debug_Connecting to false.

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug()

        Gets the Boolean value of BNC_Debug, which indicates whether or not debugging is enabled.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value indicating current debug state:
        • true - Debugging is enabled.
        • false - Debugging is disabled.

      • log

        public void log(java.lang.String tag,
                java.lang.String message)

        Creates a Log message in the debugger. If debugging is disabled, this will fail silently.

        Parameters:
        tag - - A String value specifying the logging tag to use for the message.
        message - - A String value containing the logging message to record.

      • Debug

        public static void Debug(java.lang.String tag,
                         java.lang.String message)

        Creates a Debug message in the debugger. If debugging is disabled, this will fail silently.

        Parameters:
        tag - A String value specifying the logging tag to use for the message.
        message - A String value containing the debug message to record.

      • keepDebugConnection

        public boolean keepDebugConnection()

        Sends an empty logging message to keep the debugger connection alive.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value indicating the debug connection state:
        • true - If the debug connection has been kept alive.
        • false - If the debug connection has not been kept alive, if BNC_Remote_Debug is false, or if there is no current remote connection.
